intro: Vincetoxicum emeiense, commonly known as Emei vetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
